text: The Anatolian languages were a branch of Indo-European languages. They are now extinct. They were spoken in Asia Minor (ancient Anatolia) in modern-day Turkey. There are three, or maybe four, known branches. ==Branches== Melchert (2012) has organised them like this: *Proto-Anatolian **Hittite ** Palaic ** Luwic *** Luwian *** Lycian *** Milyan *** Carian *** Sidetic *** Pisidian ** (?) Lydian ==References== Category:Indo-European languages
title: Anatolian languages
